column2: Put the verb in the correct form, present perfect or past simple.
column3: I studied German at school, but {{c1::I've forgotten|I have forgotten}} (I / forget) most of it now.

column2: Put the verb in the correct form, present perfect or past simple.
column3: The town where we live {{c1::has changed}} (change) a lot. It's very different now.

column2: Put the verb in the correct form, present perfect or past simple.
column3: I {{c1::closed}} (close) the window, but now it's open again.

column2: Put the verb in the correct form, present perfect or past simple.
column3: Where's my bike? {{c1::It was}} (It / be) outside the house, but it's not there now.

column2: Put the verb in the correct form, present perfect or past simple.
column3: You can have the newspaper. {{c1::I've finished|I have finished}} (I / finish) with it.

column2: Put the verb in the correct form, present perfect or past simple.
column3: {{c1::We washed}} (We / wash) the car, but it's dirty again now.
